intro: Pseudoridolfia fennanei, commonly known as the Fennanean pseudoridolfia, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a hairy texture, which helps reduce water loss. Pseudoridolfia fennanei is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
